First comprehensive English translation of the major comic fragments [including fragments on papyrus] since the notorious attempt by J.M. Edmonds in 1957. It only comprises playwrights, plays, and fragments of major significance and interest, according to the editor's judgement (this amounts to roughly 30% of the material in the PCG). - I. Beginnings. - II. Athenian Old Comedy. - III. Middle Comedy. - IV. New Comedy. - Epilogue: Survival of comedy in Hellenistic Greece and Republican and Imperial Rome; - Ancient theories of comedy and laughter, and ancient writers on comedy.
